alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 09 at 4:32AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .More precipitation will fall over the south slopes of the Olympics this weekend. The precipitation will start as snow but change to rain tonight as the snow levels rise to near 7000 feet. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The Skokomish River will still be at or just above action stage when the precipitation begins in the Olympics today. Rainfall forecast continues to be in the 2 to 3 inch range tonight into Sunday. Snow levels remaining low enough today for the precipitation to be in the form of snow in the Olympics. With the river already running high and the soils saturated this amount of rain could drive the Skokomish River above flood stage late tonight or Sunday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
